channel.title: Comments on: How To Extract Age of Empires 2 Definitive Sounds
channel.description: Learn and Play Age Of Empires 2 Just Better

item.title: By: Austin
item.dc:creator: Austin
item.description: If only there was one more BAT file to categorize the files. Do you have a chart or anything that says files 100-200 are Frank lines or something? Or even just identifying the most popular sounds by number? Anything?
item.content:encoded:
If only there was one more BAT file to categorize the files. Do you have a chart or anything that says files 100-200 are Frank lines or something?
Or even just identifying the most popular sounds by number? Anything?

item.title: By: Alex
item.dc:creator: Alex
item.description: How can I know what each sound is supposed to be when they are all just numbers?
item.content:encoded: How can I know what each sound is supposed to be when they are all just numbers?

item.title: By: Chris
item.dc:creator: Chris
item.description: I FOUND IT! It's 0253 for the "being attacked" sound. Although it has a second sound in the background.
item.content:encoded: I FOUND IT! It’s 0253 for the “being attacked” sound. Although it has a second sound in the background.

item.title: By: Chris
item.dc:creator: Chris
item.description: Any pointers as to which file is the "attack horn" sound? I've gone through the first 200 .ogg files and haven't found it yet. I despondent about resigning myself to searching all 4,500 files
item.content:encoded: Any pointers as to which file is the “attack horn” sound? I’ve gone through the first 200 .ogg files and haven’t found it yet. I despondent about resigning myself to searching all 4,500 files

item.title: By: Amiriachi
item.dc:creator: Amiriachi
item.description: I finally can edit my game sounds so thank you Mr GregStein ;)
item.content:encoded: I finally can edit my game sounds so thank you Mr GregStein ðŸ˜‰

item.title: By: GregStein
item.dc:creator: GregStein
item.description:
In reply to <a href="https://ageofnotes.com/tutorials/how-to-extract-age-of-empires-2-definitive-sounds/#comment-518">makemeet</a>.
I just did my "SFX.bnk" following the tutorial and everything converted instantly. Did you forget to put your .bnk file in "1- Extract SFX.bat" or your antivirus blocked/deleted something? Are you on windows 10 ?
Don't forget that you *.ogg files can't be played by regular video/audio players. Audacity is a light program and does that for you.
item.content:encoded:
In reply to makemeet.

I just did my “SFX.bnk” following the tutorial and everything converted instantly. Did you forget to put your .bnk file in “1- Extract SFX.bat” or your antivirus blocked/deleted something? Are you on windows 10 ?

Don’t forget that you *.ogg files can’t be played by regular video/audio players. Audacity is a light program and does that for you.

item.title: By: makemeet
item.dc:creator: makemeet
item.content:encoded:

can be fixed??
